page.title: 09Boot Maker,Ravensthorpe.
page.content: Mr.Horace Batten followed his great- grandfather,grandfather and father when he went into the business of Top-boot manufacturer.The firm started in l75O in Gloucester,then a county where there was much hunting,and they moved eventually to Ravensthorpe village.The business has widened its field and now makes boots for many of the top Show Jumpers and for the Cavalry both every- day and ceremonial boots.In recent years there has been a growing demand for topboots for film and stage work. Handmade beechwood lasts are used and when these last makers die out and the special leather workers,such as the hand sewers,it is feared that this industry will die with them. Mr.Batten uses his skills in a converted out- building in the grounds of his house. He employs 5 people but unfortunately has no one to follow in his footsteps.
